availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jeremiah T. Reed (Covington, KY, police officer)

body.p: Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, police officer. Kentucky native. Son of John Reed and Elizabeth Reed. Married to Mary Townsend Reed. Father of Alice Reed and James Reed. Resident of Kenton County, Kentucky, in 1850. Blacksmith in Pendleton County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the Fremont's Body Guard Missouri Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a private and blacksmith from August 20, 1861, to November 30, 1861. Blacksmith in Kenton County in 1863. Served on the gunboat U.S.S. Moose as a master-at-arms from May 14, 1864, to May 13, 1865. Police officer in Covington, Kenton County, in September 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Independence, p. 127B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 604.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 371A.
Eleventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1890), Veterans Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport (before 1911), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 7013565, Kenton County Deaths, p. 447.
Case Files of Approved Pension Applications of Widows and Other Dependents of Civil War and Later Navy Veterans (Navy Widows' Certificates), 1861â€“1910, NARA RG 15, Application 12970.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Missouri, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M405, Roll 293.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Kenton County, KY, June-July 1863, p. 370.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994043, Kenton County Births, p. 11.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Campbell County Wills, vol. B-C, 1820-1879, p. 41.
